citation.article-title: Porphyrobacter donghaensis sp. nov., isolated from sea water of the East Sea in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Porphyrobacter donghaensis sp. nov.
Porphyrobacter donghaensis (dong.ha.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. donghaensis of Donghae, the Korean name for the East Sea in Korea from which the strains were isolated).
Cells are pleomorphic: cocci, ovals or rods (0·6–0·8×0·9–2·5 μm) are present.
Colonies on MA are smooth, circular, convex, reddish-orange in colour and 0·5–0·8 mm in diameter after 7 days incubation at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at 10 and 45 °C but not at 4 or 50 °C.
The optimal pH for growth is pH 7·0–8·0; growth is observed at pH 5·0 but not at pH 4·5.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 2 % (w/v) NaCl; growth does not occur in the presence of >7 % NaCl.
Growth does not occur under anaerobic conditions on MA and on MA with nitrate.
Bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids are present.
Urease-negative.
Tween 20, Tween 40, Tween 60 and tyrosine are hydrolysed.
Hypoxanthine and xanthine are not hydrolysed.
H2S is not produced.
Sensitive to chloramphenicol (100 μg) and penicillin G (20 U).
Resistant to polymyxin B (100 U) and streptomycin (50 μg).
Maltose is utilized.
Benzoate and formate are not utilized.
The predominant respiratory lipoquinone is Q-10.
The major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c and C17 : 1ω6c.
The DNA G+C content is 65·9–66·8 mol% (66·8 mol% for the type strain) (determined by HPLC).
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Tables 1 and 2.
The type strain, SW-132T (=KCTC 12229T=DSM 16220T), and reference strain SW-158 (=KCTC 12230) were isolated from sea water from the East Sea in Korea.
